tasks.task: Operating farming vehicles on downhill slopes
subtasks: Buckling safety harness before descending the hill
Adjusting vehicle's center of gravity by shifting weight appropriately
Entering the vehicle and positioning self for control
Engaging differential lock if necessary for stability
Gradually increasing speed as descent is made, while maintaining control
Using brakes effectively to prevent excessive speed
Checking for any mechanical issues that may be exacerbated by steep slopes

tasks.task: Managing vineyard rows using ground equipment
subtasks: Positioning the vehicle accurately along the vine rows
Adjusting toolbar height for optimal engagement with the soil
Activating the rototiller or cultivator to break soil
Navigating around obstacles such as plants or rocks
Ensuring even distribution of soil work to maintain row uniformity

tasks.task: Applying dormant season weed control measures
subtasks: Selecting appropriate herbicide for dormant conditions
Ensuring application equipment is calibrated correctly
Treating the entire vineyard in a systematic manner to avoid skips
Monitoring wind direction to prevent drift onto neighboring crops or non-target areas
Identifying the proper timing for dormant pruning
Selecting the appropriate tools for cutting canes and spurs
Removing unwanted suckers and bargain vines to maintain vigor on desirable shoots
Ensuring cuts are made at the correct angle to promote healing
Placing pruned material in designated collection areas for disposal

tasks.task: Conducting soil sampling before applying nutrients
subtasks: Selecting representative samples across the vineyard
Using proper tool to extract soil cores
Placing samples into containers for analysis
Sending samples to laboratory for nutrient analysis
Measuring vineyard dimensions and planning line placement
Digging trenches for irrigation pipes
Placing pipes into trenches and backfilling
Connecting pipes to main water source and ensuring proper pressure

tasks.task: Performing maintenance on machinery before operations
subtasks: Inspecting tires for proper inflation and wear
Checking belts and chains for tightness and damage
Testing hydraulic systems for leaks or functionality
Mixing fertilizer according to label instructions
Broadcasting fertilizer uniformly over the field
Ensuring even coverage without overapplication in any area
Identifying whether pruning is needed based on bloom success
Removing excess flowering clusters to improve fruit set
Selecting healthy canes for fruiting
Thinning clusters to desired spacing for quality
Observing plants for signs of insect or disease
Identifying pests or diseases present
Collecting samples if necessary for diagnosis
Deciding on appropriate treatment measures
Monitoring sugar content and acidity levels to determine ripeness
Using correct post-harvest handling practices
Ensuring grapes are not damaged during mechanical harvest

tasks.task: Managing vineyard runoff during heavy rains
subtasks: Monitoring for soil erosion or water accumulation
Implementing measures to prevent waterlogging near vines

tasks.task: Applying herbicide during summer to control weeds
subtasks: Ensuring application is done during vine dormant periods
Avoiding spray drift onto beneficial insects or non-target plants
Choosing the right tillage tool based on soil type and weed pressure
Adjusting tilling depth to manage weed competition
Ensuring thorough coverage of the soil surface

tasks.task: Feeding livestock during critical growth phases
subtasks: Assessing animals’ nutritional needs based on life stage
Selecting appropriate feeds according to nutritional requirements
Providing supplemental feed if necessary to meet energy demands
